io.github.prolobjectlink.prolog

Interface PrologVariable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<PrologTerm>, PrologElement, PrologTerm
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PrologField, PrologParameter, PrologResult, PrologTypedField, PrologTypedParameter, PrologTypedResult

    public interface PrologVariable
extends PrologTerm
    Prolog term that represent variable data type. Prolog variables are created using PrologProvider.newVariable(int) for anonymous variables and PrologProvider.newVariable(String, int) for named variables. The Prolog variables can be used and reused because they remain in java heap. You can instantiate a prolog variable and used it any times in the same clause because refer to same variable every time. 
     
 PrologVariable x = provider.newVariable("X");
 PrologVariable y = provider.newVariable("Y");
 PrologVariable z = provider.newVariable("Z");
 engine.assertz(provider.newStructure(grandparent, x, z), provider.newStructure(parent, x, y),
                provider.newStructure(parent, y, z));
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jose Zalacain

      • isAnonymous

        boolean isAnonymous()
        Check that current variable be an anonymous variable
        Returns:
        - true if the current variable is an anonymous variable, false in other case

      • setName

        void setName(String name)
        Set the name for current prolog variable term. If the under-laying prolog variable term don't have rename option, a new under-laying variable is created with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - name to be set to the current variable.
        Since:
        1.0
